subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






May 18, 2007


                              		
                              		
                              	  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video



                              	
                              	  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation






TOP STORIESGaza Falls Deeper Into Chaos
Israeli planes continue to pound Hamas targets, and Fatah and Hamas gunmen clash on the streets of Gaza City. Hamas rockets
                        continued to fall on the Israeli border town of Sderot, to which Israel said it had to respond. More...Watch: Israel Steps Into Mayhem
• Immigration Deal Faces Uncertain Future
                     					| Watch• 2 ABC Journalists Killed In Iraq
                     					| Watch• Senators Press CIA To Release 9/11 ReportU.S.$500M Treasure Ship Found In Atlantic
Deep-sea explorers said they have mined what could be the richest shipwreck treasure in history, bringing home 17 tons of
                        colonial-era silver and gold coins from an undisclosed site in the Atlantic Ocean. Estimated value: $500 million. More...
• Rain Helps N.J. Firefighters, Winds Don't
                     					| Watch• LeMond Bombshell At Landis Hearing
                     					| Watch• "Bloomberg Gun Giveaway" Draws Crowd• More StoriesWorld2 ABC Journalists Killed In Iraq
ABC News announced that two of its Iraqi journalists in Iraq were killed in an ambush as they drove home from work. Also,
                        insurgents attacked a U.S. base, resulting in six of them being killed, and the search for three missing soldiers continues. More...Watch: Search Continues For Soldiers
• Gaza Falls Deeper Into Chaos
                     					| Watch• Deadly Blast At Historic Indian Mosque• New French Leader Names Cabinet
                     					| Watch• More StoriesPoliticsImmigration Deal Faces Uncertain Future
A bipartisan immigration deal that would grant legal status to millions of people in the country unlawfully is drawing criticism
                        from across the political spectrum. The deal will face intense scrutiny and debate in Congress next week. More...Watch: Immigration Law Deal
• Campaign Donations Used For Legal Fees• Wolfowitz On His Way Out At World Bank• Dems Seek No-Confidence Vote On Gonzales• More StoriesHealthPrescription Drug Use Up In Teen Girls
The number of teens, especially girls, taking prescription drugs for type 2 diabetes, sleep problems, and other illnesses
                        is up, according to a new report from Medco Health Solutions. More...
• Anheuser-Busch Pulls "Spykes"
                     					| Watch• 7 In 10 Puzzled By Slew Of Cancer Messages• What's In A Name? Face Shape, Maybe• More StoriesSciTechTime For Whale Rescue Plan B
Playing sounds of other humpback whales failed to lure them back down the Sacramento River to San Francisco Bay and the Pacific
                        Ocean, so now biologists will try something else. The pair are believed to be a mother and calf, and are injured. More...Watch: Whale Rescue In California
• South Florida Drought Damaging Economy• Army Lab Uses Sports Science On Soldiers• Ocean May Be Absorbing Less Carbon Dioxide• More StoriesBusinessChina Moves To Cool Sizzling Economy
China is taking steps to let its currency appreciate faster against the dollar and to cool its sizzling economy ahead of what
                        are expected to contentious talks in Washington over Beijing's soaring trade surplus. More...
• $500M Treasure Ship Found In Atlantic• Meet "Generation Plastic"
                     					| Watch• South Florida Drought Damaging Economy• More StoriesEntertainmentLeMond Bombshell At Landis Hearing
The three-time Tour de France winner testified that Landis' manager had threatened to reveal that LeMond had been sexually
                        abused as a child if LeMond showed up at the doping hearing of fellow Tour champ Landis. The manager was then fired by Landis. More...Watch: Shocker In Landis Doping Trail
• Madonna Releases New Song for Charity
                     					| Watch• Johansson to Play Mary, Queen of Scots• Manson: Divorce Left Me With "No Soul"• More StoriesOpinionClinton A Vexing Foe For Opponents
Hillary Clinton is not your typical female presidential candidate, which, as The New Republic points out, requires
                        those running against her to find new ways to blunt the advantage provided by her gender. More...Watch: Debating Dems
• Dumbed-Down Intelligence
                     					| Watch• Speed It Up• The Old Time Hypocrisy Hour
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Celeb Spot: LeMond Bombshell At Landis Hearing
The three-time Tour de France winner testified that Landis' manager had threatened to reveal that LeMond had been sexually
                        abused as a child if LeMond showed up at the doping hearing of fellow Tour champ Landis. The manager was then fired by Landis. More...Watch: Shocker In Landis Doping Trail

Panda's Birth Breaks RecordsAt the age of 14, Panda Jini gave birth to a female cub after 324 days of pregnancy. China claims Jini is the oldest panda
                                    to have a baby and the longest pregnancy period. Russ Mitchell reports.
